title: Epic Games Unveils New MetaHuman Creator - Kinda Funny Games Daily 02.10.21
description:
Download the DoorDash app in the App Store and use code GAMES2021 or GAMESCA (if you’re in Canada) to get 25% off and free delivery on your first order!

Go to http://amazon.com/GAMESRX to save on prescription medication and get FREE 2-day delivery!

Go to http://keeps.com/MORNING to get your first month of treatment for FREE!

Blessing and Imran talk about new futuristic tech from Epic, Ubisoft relying less on AAA, and Super Mario 3D World + Bowser's Fury reviews.

Time codes:
00:00:00 - Start
00:04:18 - Housekeeping
It’s a HUGE week at Kinda Funny:
Barrett is back at it like a bad habit! After releasing Zelda In Review last year, Barrett immediately started working on Assassin's Creed In Review: a Kinda Funny Games In Review special, where he played through all 12 mainline games throughout 2020, wrote his reviews for each one, ranked them, and then compiled it all into one 2 hour video for your viewing pleasure! AC In Review releases TODAY, February 10th, at 2:30pm PT on YouTube.com/KindaFunnyGames as a YouTube Premiere! So watch the video as it debuts, and hang out in the chat with Barrett and other best friends to talk about everything we love about Assassin's Creed!
Also today: the FCF activities begin with the first draft. Come to twitch.tv/kindafunnygames to draft OUR Football team with Snowbike Mike and Greg on Wednesday at 5:30 p.m. PT
Then, Saturday is Wild Aces Game Day -- the Fan Controlled Football season starts with the Wild Aces squaring off against Quavo and Richard Sherman’s Glacier Boyz. We’ll be streaming the game at 5 p.m. PT on Saturday.
AFTER the game, stick around for Love, Sex, and Stuff’s live Valentine’s Day Call-in show.
Thank you to our Patreon Producers: GrahamOfLegend, David Meintel, Trent Berrie, Black Jack, Luiz Aguiar (@8bitLuiz), James Davis (@JamesDavisMakes), &The Nano Biologist
The Roper Report   -
00:09:15 - Epic has revealed their MetaHuman Creator - Nick Statt @ The Verge
00:20:20 - Ubisoft is Moving Away From Reliance on AAA Releases - Rebekah Valentine @ IGN
00:30:55 - Speaking of: Ubisoft Could Rename Rainbow Six: Quarantine - Jordan Oloman @ IGN
00:37:00 - PS5 DualSense is having some drift issues - Marie Dealessandri @ GiBiz
00:42:22 -  Ad
00:45:10 - Super Mario 3D World + Bowser's Fury Review Round Up
00:52:05 - We have the title of the Sonic the Hedgehog movie sequel - Matt Purslow @ IGN
00:55:45 - Out today
00:59:15 - You‘re Wrong
Tomorrow’s Hosts: Greg and M.H. Williams


Subscribe! http://www.youtube.com/kindafunnygames?sub_confirmation=1

Support us and get the shows early here! http://www.patreon.com/kindafunnygames

Check out our store! http://www.kindafunny.com/store

Follow us on Twitter!
Blessing - http://www.twitter.com/BlessingJr
Tim - http://www.twitter.com/TimGettys
Greg - http://www.twitter.com/GameOverGreggy
Kinda Funny - http://www.twitter.com/KindaFunnyVids

Every day Greg Miller, Blessing Adeoye Jr., and Tim Gettys talk about the biggest stories in Video Games.

Background Wall Art by Orioto - https://www.facebook.com/OriotoPosters/

uh imran let's talk about some ue soft news story number two ubisoft is moving away from reliance on aaa releases is from rebecca valentine over at ign ubisoft doesn't want to be doesn't want to be as reliant on aaa game releases as it has in the past and will instead look more closely at free-to-play games in his back catalog to make money call today following the company's q3 financial results the publisher said that it plans that its plans for fiscal 2022 the period from april 2021 through march 2022 included three aaa game releases but then in the future ubisoft didn't want aaa games to be the focus of its business model we said for a number of years that our normal template is to come with either three or four aaa games so we'll stick that plan for fiscal 2022 but we see that we see that we are progressively continuously moving from a model that used to be only focused on aaa releases to a model where we have a combination of strong releases from aaa and strong back catalog

see that we are progressively continuously moving from a model that used to be only focused on aaa releases to a model where we have a combination of strong releases from aaa and strong back catalog dynamics but also complementing our program of new releases with free to play and other premium experiences said cfo frederick duguay or duguet buguet he went on to specify that the company had a number of titles triple a and otherwise in the pipeline naming far cry 6 rainbow six quarantine skull and bones writer's republic the prince of persia saints of time remake and roller champions he also nodded to he also nodded to a previously announced assassin's creed mobile game plan to come to china with the help of ubisoft investor tencent which he said was a part of the company ramping up its investment and its interest in free to play games especially on mobile mobile currently makes up about nine percent of the company's total business notably there wasn't a single mention on the call about
